metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript Array Const
ECMAScript 2015 (ES6)
In 2015, JavaScript introduced an important new keyword: const .
content.html: In 2015, JavaScript introduced an important new keyword: const.

content.text: It has become a common practice to declare arrays using const :
content.html: It has become a common practice to declare arrays using const:

content.code_html: const cars = ["Saab", "Volvo", "BMW"];

content.text: Cannot be Reassigned
An array declared with const cannot be reassigned:
content.html: An array declared with const cannot be reassigned:

content.code_html:
const cars = ["Saab", "Volvo", "BMW"];
cars = ["Toyota", "Volvo", "Audi"];    // ERROR

content.text: Arrays are Not Constants
The keyword const is a little misleading.
content.html: The keyword const is a little misleading.

content.text: It does NOT define a constant array. It defines a constant reference to an array.
content.html: It does NOT define a constant array. It defines a constant reference to an array.

content.text: Because of this, we can still change the elements of a constant array.
content.html: Because of this, we can still change the elements of a constant array.

content.text: Elements Can be Reassigned
You can change the elements of a constant array:
content.html: You can change the elements of a constant array:

syntaxHighlighting.text: // You can create a constant array:

syntax_highlighting.text: // You can create a constant array:

content.code_html:
// You can create a constant array:
 const cars = ["Saab", "Volvo", "BMW"];

// You can change an element:
 cars[0] = "Toyota";

// You can add an element:
 cars.push("Audi");

syntax_highlighting_data.text: // You can create a constant array:

content.text: Browser Support
The const keyword is not supported in Internet Explorer 10 or earlier.
content.html: The const keyword is not supported in Internet Explorer 10 or earlier.

content.text: The following table defines the first browser versions with full support for the const keyword:
content.html: The following table defines the first browser versions with full support for the const keyword:

content.code_html:
Chrome 49 IE 11 / Edge Firefox 36 Safari 10 Opera 36
Mar, 2016 Oct, 2013 Feb, 2015 Sep, 2016 Mar, 2016

content.text: Assigned when Declared
JavaScript const variables must be assigned a value when they are declared:
content.html: JavaScript const variables must be assigned a value when they are declared:

content.text: Meaning: An array declared with const must be initialized when it is declared.
content.html: Meaning: An array declared with const must be initialized when it is declared.

content.text: Using const without initializing the array is a syntax error:
content.html: Using const without initializing the array is a syntax error:

content.code_html:
const cars;
cars = ["Saab", "Volvo", "BMW"];

content.text: Arrays declared with var can be initialized at any time.
content.html: Arrays declared with var can be initialized at any time.

content.text: You can even use the array before it is declared:
content.html: You can even use the array before it is declared:

content.code_html:
cars = ["Saab", "Volvo", "BMW"];
var cars;

content.text: Const Block Scope
An array declared with const has Block Scope .
content.html: An array declared with const has Block Scope.

content.text: An array declared in a block is not the same as an array declared outside the block:
content.html: An array declared in a block is not the same as an array declared outside the block:

content.code_html:
const cars = ["Saab", "Volvo", "BMW"];
// Here cars[0] is "Saab"
 {
  const cars = ["Toyota", "Volvo", "BMW"];
  // Here cars[0] is "Toyota"
 }
// Here cars[0] is "Saab"

content.text: An array declared with var does not have block scope:
content.html: An array declared with var does not have block scope:

content.code_html:
var cars = ["Saab", "Volvo", "BMW"];
// Here cars[0] is "Saab"
 {
  var cars = ["Toyota", "Volvo", "BMW"];
  // Here cars[0] is "Toyota"
 }
// Here cars[0] is "Toyota"

content.text: You can learn more about Block Scope in the chapter: JavaScript Scope .
content.html: You can learn more about Block Scope in the chapter: JavaScript Scope.

content.text: Redeclaring Arrays
Redeclaring an array declared with var is allowed anywhere in a program:
content.html: Redeclaring an array declared with var is allowed anywhere in a program:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
var cars = ["Toyota", "BMW"];  // Allowed
cars = ["Volvo", "Saab"];      // Allowed

content.code:
var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
var cars = ["Toyota", "BMW"];  // Allowed
cars = ["Volvo", "Saab"];      // Allowed

syntax_highlighting.text:
var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
var cars = ["Toyota", "BMW"];  // Allowed
cars = ["Volvo", "Saab"];      // Allowed

content.code_html:
var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
 var cars = ["Toyota", "BMW"];  // Allowed
 cars = ["Volvo", "Saab"];      // Allowed

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
var cars = ["Toyota", "BMW"];  // Allowed
cars = ["Volvo", "Saab"];      // Allowed

content.text: Redeclaring or reassigning an array to const , in the same scope, or in the same block, is not allowed:
content.html: Redeclaring or reassigning an array to const, in the same scope, or in the same block, is not allowed:

content.code_html:
var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];     // Allowed
 const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Not allowed
 {
  var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
   const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Not allowed
 }

content.text: Redeclaring or reassigning an existing const array, in the same scope, or in the same block, is not allowed:
content.html: Redeclaring or reassigning an existing const array, in the same scope, or in the same block, is not allowed:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Not allowed
var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];     // Not allowed
cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];         // Not allowed

{
  const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Allowed
  const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Not allowed
  var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Not allowed
  cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];       // Not allowed
}

content.code:
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Not allowed
var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];     // Not allowed
cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];         // Not allowed

{
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Allowed
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Not allowed
var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Not allowed
cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];       // Not allowed
}

syntax_highlighting.text:
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Not allowed
var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];     // Not allowed
cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];         // Not allowed

{
  const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Allowed
  const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Not allowed
  var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Not allowed
  cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];       // Not allowed
}

content.code_html:
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
 const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Not allowed
 var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];     // Not allowed
 cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];         // Not allowed
{
  const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Allowed
   const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Not allowed
   var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Not allowed
   cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];       // Not allowed
 }

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Not allowed
var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];     // Not allowed
cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];         // Not allowed

{
  const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Allowed
  const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Not allowed
  var cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Not allowed
  cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];       // Not allowed
}

content.text: Redeclaring an array with const , in another scope, or in another block, is allowed:
content.html: Redeclaring an array with const, in another scope, or in another block, is allowed:

content.code_html:
const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"];   // Allowed
 {
  const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Allowed
 }
{
  const cars = ["Volvo", "BMW"]; // Allowed
 }

content.html: For a complete Array reference, go to our:

content.html: Complete JavaScript Array Reference.

content.html: The reference contains descriptions and examples of all Array properties and methods.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
True or False. If you declare an array with the const keyword, you cannot change the array items later.
content.html:
True or False.
If you declare an array with the const keyword, you cannot change the array items later.

metadata.question: True or False.If you declare an array with the const keyword, you cannot change the array items later.

content.question: True or False.If you declare an array with the const keyword, you cannot change the array items later.
